page.title: 20CHAPEL PUMPING STATION
page.content: The Pumping Station pumps land drainage water from the higher fields on the wolds around Willoughby and Orby and all areas nearer. All this water runs into two main drains called the Orby and Willoughby drains which join together west of the Pump house.The water is only pumped out after a large rainfall .Drain weed sometimes clogs up the pumps.When there are floods from the drains it is manned 24 hourly.The station is only manned when it is raining heavily. Three pumps,two deisel and one electric work the pump house.It can pump 280 gollons of water per minute.The heaviest rainfall recorded was 3 and a half inches in 24 hours.One inch (2 and a half cm)of rainfall per acre is 100 tons of water.This pumping station controls 33,00 acres of land.
